item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 13, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Privacy Pass Authentication for Kagi Search (260 points | 106 comments)
2. Phind 2: AI search with visual answers and multi-step reasoning (207 points | 91 comments)
3. MapTCHA, the open-source CAPTCHA that improves OpenStreetMap [video] (70 points | 11 comments)
4. Who exactly needs to get approval from an institutional review board (IRB)? (168 points | 109 comments)
5. Why does Mill use Scala? (34 points | 7 comments)
6. Basis of the Kalman Filter [pdf] (115 points | 12 comments)
7. LibreOffice still kicking at 40, now with browser tricks and real-time collab (307 points | 110 comments)
8. Amazon ends kindle ebooks "Download and Transfer via USB" (29 points | 27 comments)
9. Fewer students are enrolling in doctoral degrees (68 points | 112 comments)
10. MESI Cache Coherency Protocol Visualization (12 points | 1 comment)
11. SQL pipe syntax available in public preview in BigQuery (176 points | 86 comments)
12. Tolerating full cloud outages with Monzo Stand-in (40 points | 20 comments)
13. Nvidia Security Team: "What if we just stopped using C?" (2022) (4 points | discuss)
14. JesseSort: A novel sorting algorithm that is faster than Python's default sort. (6 points | discuss)
15. Magnetic field sorting of superconducting graphite particles with Tc>400K (2024) (51 points | 31 comments)
16. Self hosted FLOSS fitness/workout tracker (163 points | 89 comments)
17. How Hans Bethe Stumbled Upon Perfect Quantum Theories (10 points | 1 comment)
18. Better text rendering in Chromium-based browsers on Windows (122 points | 100 comments)
19. The Human Alphabet (12 points | 2 comments)
20. Why Does Integer Addition Approximate Float Multiplication? (149 points | 55 comments)
21. WASM-Native Orchestration (54 points | 18 comments)
22. Resigning as Asahi Linux project lead (866 points | 716 comments)
23. Learning fast and accurate absolute pitch judgment in adulthood (56 points | 19 comments)
24. An Infinitely Large Napkin [pdf] (2019) (157 points | 27 comments)
25. White Hat Hackers Expose Iridium Satellite Security Flaws (111 points | 30 comments)
26. Cheap blood test detects pancreatic cancer before it spreads (284 points | 162 comments)
27. Residential Networking over Telephone (86 points | 30 comments)
28. Smuggling arbitrary data through an emoji (656 points | 179 comments)
29. The Death of the Web (2024) (54 points | 43 comments)
30. Thinkserver: My web-based coding environment (211 points | 60 comments)
